articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as the Netherlands play Afghanistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Afghanistan strike in first over against Netherlands

articles.description: England Test captain Ben Stokes says he will undergo surgery to address his ongoing knee issue after the World Cup.
articles.title: Stokes to have knee surgery after World Cup

articles.description: All the latest from Friday's Premier League news conferences, plus build-up to the FA Cup first round.
articles.title: Premier League news conferences & weekend build-up

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he will allow Luis Diaz to decide whether he is available this weekend following the kidnapping of his father in Colombia.
articles.title: Klopp will let Diaz decide on availability

articles.description: Wasteful Wales end their WXV campaign winless after failing to beat 14-player Australia in Auckland.
articles.title: Wasteful Wales defeated by 14-player Wallaroos

articles.description: Watch as some superb fielding from Afghanistan leads to three Netherland wickets in their World Cup match in Lucknow, India.
articles.title: Superb Afghanistan fielding takes three Netherland wickets

articles.description: Bromley boss Andy Woodman, who is best friends with England manager Gareth Southgate, is targeting an FA Cup upset when his non-league side host Blackpool.
articles.title: Southgate's best man aiming for FA Cup upset

articles.description: Manchester United's ownership situation needs a quicker resolution to bring greater clarity to Erik ten Hag's position, numerous sources connected to the club tell BBC Sport.
articles.title: Man Utd takeover must speed up for Ten Hag clarity - sources

articles.description: After 11 months out Beth Mead is back, but it has been a difficult and emotional rehabilitation for the Arsenal and England forward.
articles.title: Inside Mead's 'gruelling' 11-month ACL recovery

articles.description: Running back Jaylen Warren stars as the Pittsburgh Steelers score a late touchdown to beat the Tennessee Titans 20-16.
articles.title: Watch: Warren stars as Steelers beat Titans
